views.name: Default view
views.description: The default view of the data.

views.name: Densely annotated training data
views.description: Fifteen manually annotated regions used for training machine learning networks, as described in Fig. 1a of Heinrich et al., 2020.

views.name: Microtubule predictions
views.description: Area used for validating microtubule renderings, as described in Fig. 2c of Heinrich et al., 2020

views.name: Refined, whole-cell predictions
views.description: Renderings of refined predictions for multiple organelles, as presented in Fig. 2e of Heinrich et al., 2020

views.name: Microtubule, multi-organelle contact sites
views.description: Example of a microtubule interacting with five different organelles, including endosomes, the endoplasmic reticulum, Golgi, nucleus, and vesicles. A description can be found in Fig. 3b of Heinrich et al., 2020.

views.name: Endoplasmic reticulum curvature and mitochondria contact sites
views.description: Example of planar regions of endoplasmic reticulum supported by mitochondria, as described in Heinrich et al., 2020

views.name: Endoplasmic reticulum curvature and ribosome contact sites
views.description: Ribosomes classified according to surface they are bound to, including the Nucleus, planar or tubular regions of the endoplasmic reticulum, or unbound in the cytosol. A description can be found in Fig. 3g of Heinrich et al., 2020.

views.name: Mitochondria refinement
views.description: Machine learning predictions for organelles such as mitochondria are oftern merged. To prevent overmerging, a combinated of watershed segmentation and agglomeration was applied to correctly "split" mitochondria. A detailed description can be found in Heinrich et al., 2020.

views.name: Mitochondria skeletons
views.description: Topological thinning of mitochondria segmentations produces skeletons that can then be used for subsequent analysis such as length and diameter, as described in Supplmentatry Data 8 of Heinrich et al., 2020.

views.name: Endoplasmic reticulum and mitochondria contact sites
views.description: There is often interesting biology that occurs when two organelles are in contact with one another. Here, ER and mitochondria segmentations are used to calculate ER-mitochondria contact sites as described in Supplementary Data 9 of Heinrich et al., 2020.

views.name: Endoplasmic reticulum medial surface and curvature
views.description: The morphology of the endoplasmic reticulum segmentations was measured by first applying an iterative thinning procedure. This produced a medial surface, from which a planar metric could be calculated at each voxel. These planar metric values are then used to reconstruct the endoplasmic reticulum with curvature information. For a more detailed description see Supplementary Methods: Quantification of Heinrich et al., 2020.
